intro: Thesium ulugurense, commonly known as the Uluguru thesium, is a flowering plant native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants known for their showy inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
